quote0.quote: To be happy in this world, especially when youth is past, it is necessary to feel oneself not merely an isolated individual whose day will soon be over, but part of the stream of life slowing on from the first germ to the remote and unknown future.
quote0.author: Bertrand Russell

quote1.quote: Anything you're good at contributes to happiness.
quote1.author: Bertrand Russell

quote2.quote: Few people can be happy unless they hate some other person, nation, or creed.
quote2.author: Bertrand Russell

quote3.quote: Happiness is not best achieved by those who seek it directly.
quote3.author: Bertrand Russell

quote4.quote: Men who are unhappy, like men who sleep badly, are always proud of the fact.
quote4.author: Bertrand Russell

quote5.quote: The good life, as I conceive it, is a happy life. I do not mean that if you are good you will be happy; I mean that if you are happy you will be good.
quote5.author: Bertrand Russell

quote6.quote: The secret of happiness is this: let your interests be as wide as possible, and let your reactions to the things and persons that interest you be as far as possible friendly rather than hostile.
quote6.author: Bertrand Russell

quote7.quote: To be without some of the things you want is an indispensable part of happiness.
quote7.author: Bertrand Russell

quote8.quote: If there were in the world today any large number of people who desired their own happiness more than they desired the unhappiness of others, we could have a paradise in a few years.
quote8.author: Bertrand Russell

quote9.quote: O Holy Spirit, descend plentifully into my heart. Enlighten the dark corners of this neglected dwelling and scatter there Thy cheerful beams.
quote9.author: Saint Augustine of Hippo

quote10.quote: It is not fitting, when one is in God's service, to have a gloomy face or a chilling look.
quote10.author: Saint Francis of Assisi

quote11.quote: It is in the compelling zest of high adventure and of victory, and in creative action, that man finds his supreme joys.
quote11.author: Antoine De Saint-Exupery

quote12.quote: True happiness comes from the joy of deeds well done, the zest of creating things new.
quote12.author: Antoine De Saint-Exupery

quote13.quote: There is only one happiness in life, to love and be loved...
quote13.author: George SandLetter to Lina Calamatta, 1862

quote14.quote: Knowledge of what is possible is the beginning of happiness.
quote14.author: George Santayana

quote15.quote: Happiness is the only sanction of life; where happiness fails, existence remains a mad and lamentable experience.
quote15.author: George Santayana

quote16.quote: Work and live to serve others, to leave the world a little better than you found it and garner for yourself as much peace of mind as you can. This is happiness.
quote16.author: David Sarnoff

quote17.quote: The greatest happiness you can have is knowing that you do not necessarily require happiness.
quote17.author: William Saroyan

quote18.quote: Happiness is not having what you want, but wanting what you have.
quote18.author: Rabbi H. Schachtel

quote19.quote: The two enemies of human happiness are pain and boredom.
quote19.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote20.quote: Joy comes from using your potential.
quote20.author: Will Schultz

quote21.quote: Lead the life that will make you kindly and friendly to everyone about you, and you will be surprised what a happy life you will lead.
quote21.author: Charles M. Schwab

quote22.quote: True happiness is to enjoy the present, without anxious dependence upon the future, not to amuse ourselves with either hopes or fears but to rest satisfied with what we have, which is sufficient, for he that is so wants nothing. The great blessings of mankind are within us and within our reach. A wise man is content with his lot, whatever it may be, without wishing for what he has not.
quote22.author: Seneca (Seneca the Elder)

quote23.quote: I had rather have a fool make me merry, than experience make me sad.
quote23.author: William Shakespeare

quote24.quote: But O, how bitter a thing it is to look into happiness through another man's eyes.
quote24.author: William Shakespeare

quote25.quote: If you're ever given the choice between happiness and intelligence choose happiness
quote25.author: Source Unknown

quote26.quote: It is kind of happiness to know to what extent we may be unhappy.
quote26.author: Source Unknown

quote27.quote: Next to temperance, a quiet conscience, a cheerful mind and active habits, I place early rising as a means of health and happiness.
quote27.author: Source Unknown

quote28.quote: The secret to happiness is not in doing what one likes to do, but in liking what one has to do.
quote28.author: Source Unknown

quote29.quote: The biggest lie on the planet: When I get what I want, I will be happy.
quote29.author: Source Unknown

quote30.quote: Not what you have, but what you see; Not what you see, but what you choose; Not what seems fair, but what is true; Not what you dream, but what you do; Not what you take, but what you give; Not as you pray, but as you live. These are the things that mar or bless The sum of human happiness.
quote30.author: Source Unknown

quote31.quote: Happiness is the act of being tough with ourselves and tender with others.
quote31.author: Source Unknown

quote32.quote: After what we can say you can be sure the happy heart will make the happy day.
quote32.author: Source Unknown

quote33.quote: Happiness consists of three things; Someone to love, work to do, and a clear conscience.
quote33.author: Source Unknown

quote34.quote: Happiness is good for the body but sorrow strengthens the spirit.
quote34.author: Source Unknown

quote35.quote: Happiness will never come to those who fail to appreciate what they already have.
quote35.author: Source Unknown

quote36.quote: Happiness is in the heart, not in the circumstances.
quote36.author: Source Unknown

quote37.quote: Cheerfulness greases the axles of the world.
quote37.author: Source Unknown

quote38.quote: Cheerfulness removes the rust from the mind, lubricates our inward machinery, and enables us to do our work with fewer creaks and ;groans. If people were universally cheerful, probably there wouldn't be half the quarreling or a tenth part of the wickedness
quote38.author: Source Unknown

quote39.quote: There is no danger of developing eyestrain from looking on the bright side of things.
quote39.author: Source Unknown

quote40.quote: Where there is joy there is creation. Where there is no joy there is no creation: know the nature of joy.
quote40.author: Veda Upanishads

quote41.quote: That which you create in beauty and goodness and truth lives on for all time to come. Don't spend your life accumulating material objects that will only turn to dust and ashes.
quote41.author: Denis Waitley

quote42.quote: Happiness cannot be traveled to, owned, earned, worn or consumed. Happiness is the spiritual experience of living every minute with love, grace, and gratitude.
quote42.author: Denis Waitley

quote43.quote: It is not in the pursuit of happiness that we find fulfillment, it is in the happiness of pursuit.
quote43.author: Denis Waitley

quote44.quote: Happiness comes from... some curious adjustment to life.
quote44.author: Sir Hugh Walpole

quote45.quote: Happiness is not a brilliant climax to years of grim struggle and anxiety. It is a long succession of little decisions simply to be happy in the moment.
quote45.author: J. Donald Walters

quote46.quote: Happiness is understanding that friendship is more precious than mere things, more precious than getting your own way, more precious than being in situations where true principles are not at stake.
quote46.author: J. Donald Walters

quote47.quote: I am still determined to be cheerful and happy, in whatever situation I may be; for I have also learned from experience that the greater part of our happiness or misery depends upon our dispositions, and not upon our circumstances.
quote47.author: Martha Washington

quote48.quote: Happiness is not in having being; it is in doing.
quote48.author: Lilian Eichler Watson

quote49.quote: If only we'd stop trying to be happy we could have a pretty good time.
quote49.author: Edith Wharton

quote50.quote: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts: therefore, guard accordingly, and take care that you entertain no notions unsuitable to virtue and reasonable nature.
quote50.author: Marcus Aurelius

quote51.quote: Remember that very little is needed to make a happy life.
quote51.author: Marcus Aurelius

quote52.quote: To be free minded and cheerfully disposed at hours of meat and sleep and of exercise is one of the best precepts of long lasting.
quote52.author: Francis Bacon

quote53.quote: Happiness is a small and unworthy goal for something as big and fancy as a whole lifetime, and should be taken in small doses.
quote53.author: Russell Baker

quote54.quote: It's a helluva start, being able to recognize what makes you happy.
quote54.author: Lucille Ball

quote55.quote: Real happiness is cheap enough, yet how dearly we pay for its counterfeit.
quote55.author: Hosea Ballou

quote56.quote: The secret of happiness is not in doing what one likes, but in liking what one does.
quote56.author: James Barrie

quote57.quote: Happiness often sneaks in through a door you didn
quote57.author: John Barrymore

quote58.quote: Happiness is a conscious choice, not an automatic response.
quote58.author: Mildred Barthel

quote59.quote: We find greatest joy, not in getting, but in expressing what we are. Men do not really live for honors or for pay; their gladness is not the taking and holding, but in doing, the striving, the building, the living. It is a higher joy to teach than to be taught. It is good to get justice, but better to do it; fun to have things but more to make them. The happy man is he who lives the life of love, not for the honors it may bring, but for the life itself.
quote59.author: R.J. Baughan

quote60.quote: Happiness includes chiefly the idea of satisfaction after full honest effort. No one can possibly be satisfied and no one can be happy who feels that in some paramount affairs he failed to take up the challenge of life.
quote60.author: Arnold Bennett

quote61.quote: Happiness is like a cat, If you try to coax it or call it, it will avoid you; it will never come. But if you pay not attention to it and go about your business, you'll find it rubbing against your legs and jumping into your lap.
quote61.author: William John Bennett

quote62.quote: When one is happy there is no time to be fatigued; being happy engrosses the whole attention.
quote62.author: Edward Frederic Benson

quote63.quote: The said truth is that it is the greatest happiness of the greatest number that is the measure of right and wrong.
quote63.author: Jeremy Bentham

quote64.quote: Happiness is good health and a bad memory.
quote64.author: Ingrid Bergman

quote65.quote: The key to happiness is good health and a bad memory
quote65.author: Ingrid Bergman

quote66.quote: There is no greater joy than that of feeling oneself a creator. The triumph of life is expressed by creation.
quote66.author: Henri Bergson

quote67.quote: Happiness is an agreeable sensation, arising from contemplating the misery of others.
quote67.author: Ambrose Bierce

quote68.quote: A good way I know to find happiness, is to not bore a hole to fit the plug.
quote68.author: Josh Billings

quote69.quote: If you ever find happiness by hunting for it, you will find it as the old woman did her lost spectacles. Safe on her own nose all the time.
quote69.author: Josh Billings

quote70.quote: The world's literature and folklore are full of stories that point out how futile it can be to seek happiness. Rather, happiness is a blessing that comes to you as you go along; a treasure that you incidentally find.
quote70.author: Louis Binstock

quote71.quote: It is the paradox of life that the way to miss pleasure is to seek it first. The very first condition of lasting happiness is that a life should be full of purpose, aiming at something outside self.
quote71.author: Hugo Black

quote72.quote: Not only is there a right to be happy, there is a duty to be happy. So much sadness exists in the world that we are all under obligation to contribute as much joy as lies within our powers.
quote72.author: John S. Bonnell

quote73.quote: All you need for happiness is a good gun, a good horse, and a good wife.
quote73.author: Daniel Boone

quote74.quote: Because gratification of a desire leads to the temporary stilling of the mind and the experience of the peaceful, joyful Self, it's no wonder that we get hooked on thinking that happiness comes from the satisfaction of desires. This is the meaning of the old adage, Joy is not in things, it is in us.
quote74.author: Joan Borysenko

quote75.quote: The happiest people are those who think the most interesting thoughts. Those who decide to use leisure as a means of mental development, who love good music, good books, good pictures, good company, good conversation, are the happiest people in the world. And they are not only happy in themselves, they are the cause of happiness in others.
quote75.author: William Lyon Phelps

quote76.quote: The happier the moment the shorter.
quote76.author: Pliny The Elder

quote77.quote: Do not speak of your happiness to one less fortunate than yourself.
quote77.author: Plutarch

quote78.quote: Happy the man whose wish and care a few paternal acres bound, content to breathe his native air in his own ground.
quote78.author: Alexander Pope

quote79.quote: Know then this truth, enough for man to know virtue alone is happiness below.
quote79.author: Alexander Pope

quote80.quote: Happiness is a sunbeam which may pass through a thousand bosoms without losing a particle of its original ray; nay, when it strikes on a kindred heart, like the converged light on a mirror, it reflects itself with redoubled brightness. It is not perfected till it is shared.
quote80.author: Jane Porter

quote81.quote: Our happiness in this world depends on the affections we are able to inspire.
quote81.author: Duchess Prazlin

quote82.quote: Even if happiness forgets you a little bit, never completely forget about it.
quote82.author: Jacques Prevert

quote83.quote: Let us be grateful to people who make us happy; they are the charming gardeners who make our souls blossom.
quote83.author: Marcel Proust

quote84.quote: Happiness serves hardly any other purpose than to make unhappiness possible.
quote84.author: Marcel Proust

quote85.quote: If you cannot renounce the world the genius of happiness will never salute you.
quote85.author: Prutz

quote86.quote: It is not easy to find happiness in ourselves, and it is not possible to find it elsewhere.
quote86.author: Agnes Repplier

quote87.quote: Joy descends gently upon us like the evening dew, and does not patter down like a hailstorm.
quote87.author: Jean Paul Richter

quote88.quote: We are more interested in making others believe we are happy than in trying to be happy ourselves.
quote88.author: Francois de la Rochefoucauld

quote89.quote: We are never so happy nor so unhappy as we imagine.
quote89.author: Francois de la Rochefoucauld

quote90.quote: It is wrong to assume that men of immense wealth are always happy.
quote90.author: John D. Rockefeller

quote91.quote: The road to happiness lies in two simple principles; find what interests you and that you can do well, and put your whole soul into it - every bit of energy and ambition and natural ability you have.
quote91.author: John D. Rockefeller

quote92.quote: Happiness is not something you postpone for the future; it is something you design for the present.
quote92.author: Jim Rohn

quote93.quote: The journey to happiness involves finding the courage to go down into ourselves and take responsibility for what's there: all of it.
quote93.author: Richard Rohr

quote94.quote: Happiness depends more on how life strikes you than on what happens.
quote94.author: Andy Rooney

quote95.quote: Happiness is not a goal, it is a by-product.
quote95.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote96.quote: Happiness comes only when we push our brains and hearts to the farthest reaches of which we are capable.
quote96.author: Leo Rosten

quote97.quote: The thirst after happiness is never extinguished in the heart of man.
quote97.author: Jean Jacques Rousseau

quote98.quote: Happiness does not come from doing easy work but from the afterglow of satisfaction that comes after the achievement of a difficult task that demanded our best.
quote98.author: Theodore Rubin

quote99.quote: To watch the corn grow, or the blossoms set; to draw hard breath over the plough or spade; to read, to think, to love, to pray, are the things that make men happy.
quote99.author: John Ruskin

quote100.quote: If you want happiness for an hour -- take a nap. If you want happiness for a day -- go fishing. If you want happiness for a month -- get married. If you want happiness for a year -- inherit a fortune. If you want happiness for a lifetime -- help someone else.
quote100.author: Chinese Proverb

quote101.quote: Happiness is like a sunbeam, which the least shadow intercepts, while adversity is often as the rain of spring.
quote101.author: Chinese Proverb

quote102.quote: If you want to be happy for a year, plant a garden; If you want to be happy for life, plant a tree.
quote102.author: English Proverb

quote103.quote: Happiness is a choice that requires effort at times.
quote103.author: Anon.

quote104.quote: Where one is wise two are happy.
quote104.author: Proverb

quote105.quote: While we pursue happiness, we flee from contentment.
quote105.author: Proverb

quote106.quote: He is rich who owes nothing.
quote106.author: Proverb

quote107.quote: Happiness is not a horse, you cannot harness it.
quote107.author: Proverb

quote108.quote: There is no happiness; there are only moments of happiness.
quote108.author: Proverb

quote109.quote: Many persons have a wrong idea of what constitutes true happiness. It is not attained through self-gratification but through fidelity to a worthy purpose.
quote109.author: Joseph Addison

quote110.quote: Three grand essentials to happiness in this life are something to do, something to love, and something to hope for.
quote110.author: Joseph Addison

quote111.quote: Cheerfulness is the best promoter of health and is as friendly to the mind as to the body.
quote111.author: Joseph Addison

quote112.quote: What sunshine is to flowers, smiles are to humanity. These are but trifles, to be sure; but, scattered along life's pathway, the good they do is inconceivable.
quote112.author: Joseph Addison

quote113.quote: True happiness is of a retired nature, and an enemy to pomp and noise; it arises, in the first place, from the enjoyment of one's self, and in the next from the friendship and conversation of a few select companions.
quote113.author: Joseph Addison

quote114.quote: Happiness is a positive cash flow.
quote114.author: Fred Adler

quote115.quote: Call no man happy till he is dead.
quote115.author: Aeschylus

quote116.quote: Happy is the son whose faith in his mother remains unchallenged.
quote116.author: Louisa May Alcott

quote117.quote: It isn't necessary to be rich and famous to be happy. It's only necessary to be rich.
quote117.author: Alan Alda

quote118.quote: To live we must conquer incessantly, we must have the courage to be happy.
quote118.author: Henri Frederic Amiel

quote119.quote: Only one thing has to change for us to know happiness in our lives: where we focus our attention.
quote119.author: Greg Anderson

quote120.quote: Most people would rather be certain they're miserable, than risk being happy.
quote120.author: Robert Anthony

quote121.quote: Now and then it's good to pause in our pursuit of happiness and just be happy.
quote121.author: Guillaume Apollinaire

quote122.quote: ...happiness is the highest good, being a realization and perfect practice of virtue, which some can attain, while others have little or none of it...
quote122.author: Aristotle

quote123.quote: If happiness is activity in accordance with excellence, it is reasonable that it should be in accordance with the highest excellence.
quote123.author: Aristotle

quote125.quote: To buy happiness is to sell soul.
quote125.author: Doug Horton

quote126.quote: It's not a question of happiness, it's a requirement. Consider the alternative.
quote126.author: Doug Horton

quote127.quote: Happiness in the present is only shattered by comparison with the past.
quote127.author: Doug Horton

quote128.quote: You have succeeded in life when all you really want is only what you really need.
quote128.author: Vernon Howard

quote129.quote: It is pretty hard to tell what does bring happiness; poverty and wealth have both failed.
quote129.author: Kin Hubbard

quote130.quote: Life's greatest happiness is to be convinced we are loved.
quote130.author: Victor Hugo

quote131.quote: I am more and more convinced that our happiness or our unhappiness depends far more on the way we meet the events of life than on the nature of those events themselves.
quote131.author: Karl Wilhelm Von Humboldt

quote132.quote: Human happiness seems to consist in three ingredients; action, pleasure and indolence. And though these ingredients ought to be mixed in different proportions, according to the disposition of the person, yet no one ingredient can be entirely wanting without destroying in some measure the relish of the whole composition. composition.
quote132.author: David Hume

quote133.quote: I can sympathize with people's pains, but not with their pleasures. There is something curiously boring about somebody else's happiness.
quote133.author: Aldous Huxley

quote134.quote: Actual happiness looks pretty squalid in comparison with the overcompensations for misery. And, of course, stability isn
quote134.author: Aldous HuxleyBrave New World

quote135.quote: Happiness is the only good. The time to be happy is now. The place to be happy is here. The way to be happy is to make others so.
quote135.author: Robert G. Ingersoll

quote136.quote: Happiness is not a reward -- it is a consequence. Suffering is not a punishment -- it is a result.
quote136.author: Robert G. Ingersoll

quote137.quote: Those who seek happiness miss it, and those who discuss it, lack it.
quote137.author: Holbrook Jackson

quote138.quote: Happiness comes of the capacity to feel deeply, to enjoy simply, to think freely, to risk life, to be needed. which give happiness. Thomas Jefferson We never enjoy perfect happiness; our most fortunate successes are mingled with sadness; some anxieties always perplex the reality of our satisfaction.
quote138.author: William James

quote139.quote: The path to cheerfulness is to sit cheerfully and to act and speak as if cheerfulness were already there.
quote139.author: William James

quote140.quote: Thus the sovereign voluntary path to cheerfulness, if cheerfulness be lost, is to sit up cheerfully and to act and speak as if cheerfulness were already there.
quote140.author: William James

quote141.quote: The really happy person is the one who can enjoy the scenery, even when they have to take a detour.
quote141.author: Sir James Jeans

quote142.quote: Happiness is not being pained in body or troubled in mind.
quote142.author: Thomas Jefferson

quote143.quote: Our greatest happiness does not depend on the condition of life in which chance has placed us, but is always the result of a good conscience, good health, occupation, and freedom in all just pursuits.
quote143.author: Thomas Jefferson

quote144.quote: A mind always employed is always happy. This is the true secret, the grand recipe, for felicity.
quote144.author: Thomas Jefferson

quote145.quote: Happiness grows at our own firesides, and is not to be picked in stranger's gardens.
quote145.author: Douglas William Jerrold

quote146.quote: Cheer up! The worst is yet to come!
quote146.author: Philander Johnson

quote147.quote: Sir, that all who are happy, are equally happy, is not true. A peasant and a philosopher may be equally satisfied, but not equally happy. Happiness consists in the multiplicity of agreeable consciousness.
quote147.author: Samuel Johnson

quote148.quote: To strive with difficulties, and to conquer them, is the highest human felicity.
quote148.author: Samuel Johnson

quote149.quote: We are long before we are convinced that happiness is never to be found; and each believes it possessed by others, to keep alive the hope of obtaining it for himself.
quote149.author: Samuel Johnson

quote150.quote: It is the chiefest point of happiness that a man is willing to be what he is.
quote150.author: Desiderius Erasmus

quote151.quote: Farms and in castles, in homes, studies, and cloisters -- where sensible people manage to live relatively lusty and decent lives, as moral as they must be, as free as they may be, and as masterly as they can be. If we only knew it, this elusive arrangement is happiness.
quote151.author: Erik H. Erickson

quote152.quote: Enjoy your happiness while you have it, and while, you have it do not too closely scrutinize its foundation.
quote152.author: Joseph Farrell

quote153.quote: Some of us might find happiness if we quit struggling so desperately for it.
quote153.author: William Feather

quote154.quote: One of the indictments of civilizations is that happiness and intelligence are so rarely found in the same person.
quote154.author: William Feather

quote155.quote: If we cannot live so as to be happy, let us so live as to deserve happiness.
quote155.author: Johann G. Fichte

quote156.quote: To be happy is not the purpose of our being rather it is to deserve happiness.
quote156.author: Johann G. Fichte

quote157.quote: Scarcely one person in a thousand is capable of tasting the happiness of others.
quote157.author: Henry Fielding

quote158.quote: Yet, as great joy, especially after a sudden change and revolution of circumstances, is apt to be silent, and dwells rather in the heart than on the tongue...http://www.literaturepage.com/read/tom-jones-914.html
quote158.author: Henry FieldingThe History of Tom Jones, a foundling

quote159.quote: A great obstacle to happiness is to expect too much happiness.
quote159.author: Bernard Le Bovier Fontenelle

quote160.quote: When what we are is what we want to be, that's happiness.
quote160.author: Malcolm Stevenson Forbes

quote161.quote: Happy were men if they but understood There is no safety but in doing good
quote161.author: John Fountain

quote162.quote: Whoever is happy will make others happy too.
quote162.author: Anne Frank

quote163.quote: There are two ways of being happy: We must either diminish our wants or augment our means -- either may do -- the result is the same and it is for each man to decide for himself and to do that which happens to be easier.
quote163.author: Benjamin Franklin

quote164.quote: Happiness consists more in small conveniences of pleasures that occur every day, than in great pieces of good fortune that happen but seldom to a man in the course of his life.
quote164.author: Benjamin Franklin

quote165.quote: A cheerful face is nearly as good for an invalid as healthy weather.
quote165.author: Benjamin Franklin

quote166.quote: The Constitution only gives people the right to pursue happiness. You have to catch it yourself.
quote166.author: Benjamin Franklin

quote167.quote: One feels inclined to say that the intention that man should be happy is not included in the plan of Creation.
quote167.author: Sigmund Freud

quote168.quote: Happiness makes up in height for what it lacks in length.
quote168.author: Robert Frost

quote169.quote: An ounce of cheerfulness is worth a pound of sadness to serve God with.
quote169.author: Thomas Fuller

quote170.quote: Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony.
quote170.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote171.quote: True happiness involves the full use of one's power and talents.
quote171.author: John W. Gardner

quote172.quote: The hardest habit of all to break is the terrible habit of happiness.
quote172.author: Theodosia Garrison

quote173.quote: Do you want my one-word secret of happiness -- It's growth -- mental, financial, you name it.
quote173.author: Harold S. Geneen

quote174.quote: There's a hope for every woe, and a balm for every pain, but the first joys of our heart come never back again!
quote174.author: Robert Gilfillan

quote175.quote: The most manifest sign of wisdom is a continual cheerfulness; her state is like that in the regions above the moon, always clear and serene.
quote175.author: Michel de Montaigne

quote176.quote: The most certain sign of wisdom is cheerfulness.
quote176.author: Michel de Montaigne

quote177.quote: False happiness renders men stern and proud, and that happiness is never communicated. True happiness renders them kind and sensible, and that happiness is always shared.
quote177.author: Charles Montesquieu

quote178.quote: If one only wished to be happy, this could be easily accomplished; but we wish to be happier that other people, and this is always difficult, for we believe others to be happier than they are.
quote178.author: Charles Montesquieu

quote179.quote: There is something ridiculous and even quite indecent in an individual claiming to be happy. Still more a people or a nation making such a claim. The pursuit of happiness... is without any question the most fatuous which could possibly be undertaken. This lamentable phrase the pursuit of happiness is responsible for a good part of the ills and miseries of the modern world.
quote179.author: Malcolm Muggeridge

quote180.quote: I can say that I never knew what joy was like until I gave up pursuing happiness, or cared to live until I chose to die. For these two discoveries I am beholden to Jesus.
quote180.author: Malcolm Muggeridge

quote181.quote: No burden is so heavy for a man to bear as a succession of happy days.
quote181.author: Max Muller

quote182.quote: He's simply got the instinct for being unhappy highly developed.
quote182.author: Hector Hugh Munro

quote183.quote: Happiness is a matter of one's most ordinary everyday mode of consciousness being busy and lively and unconcerned with self. To be damned is for one's ordinary everyday mode of consciousness to be unremitting agonizing preoccupation with self.
quote183.author: Iris Murdoch

quote184.quote: Most of us experience happiness when we are enjoying life and feeling free, enjoying the process and products of our creative and intellectual processes, enjoying the ecstasy of transcendent oneness with the universe.
quote184.author: James Muriel

quote185.quote: What a man really wants is creative challenge with sufficient skills to bring him within the reach of success so that he may have the expanding joy of achievement.
quote185.author: Fay B. Nash

quote186.quote: The most exciting happiness is the happiness generated by forces beyond your control.
quote186.author: Ogden Nash

quote187.quote: Nobody really cares if you're miserable, so you might as well be happy.
quote187.author: Cynthia Nelms

quote188.quote: Happiness adds and multiplies, as we divide it with others.
quote188.author: A. Nielsen

quote189.quote: Happiness is the harvest of a quiet eye.
quote189.author: Austin O'Malley

quote190.quote: What happiness is there which is not purchased with more or less of pain?
quote190.author: Margaret Oliphant

quote191.quote: The foolish man seeks happiness in the distance; The wise grows it under his feet.
quote191.author: J. Robert Oppenheimer

quote192.quote: It is only when we are very happy, that we can bear to gaze merrily upon the vast and limitless expanse of water, rolling on and on with such persistent, irritating monotony, to the accompaniment of our thoughts, whether grave or gay. When they are gay, the waves echo their gaiety; but when they are sad, then every breaker, as it rolls, seems to bring additional sadness, and to speak to us of hopelessness and of the pettiness of all our joys.
quote192.author: Baroness Emmuska OrczyThe Scarlet Pimpernel

quote193.quote: Men can only be happy when they do not assume that the object of life is happiness
quote193.author: George Orwell

quote194.quote: Happiness is a by product of an effort to make someone else happy.
quote194.author: Gretta Brooker Palmer

quote195.quote: Our happiness depends on the habit of mind we cultivate. So practice happy thinking every day. Cultivate the merry heart, develop the happiness habit, and life will become a continual feast.
quote195.author: Norman Vincent Peale

quote196.quote: As happy a man as any in the world, for the whole world seems to smile upon me!
quote196.author: Samuel Pepys

quote197.quote: I went out to Charing Cross to see Major General Harrison hanged, drawn, and quartered; which was done there, he looking as cheerful as any man could in that condition.
quote197.author: Samuel Pepys

quote198.quote: Happiness doesn't come from doing what we like to do but from liking what we have to do.
quote198.author: Wilferd A. Peterson

quote199.quote: Happiness must be cultivated. It is like character. It is not a thing to be safely let alone for a moment, or it will run to weeds.
quote199.author: Elizabeth Stuart Phelps

quote200.quote: The voluntary path to cheerfulness, if our spontaneous be lost, is to sit up cheerfully, and act and speak as if cheerfulness wee already there. To feel brave, act as if we were brave, use all our will to that end, and courage will very likely replace fear. If we act as if from some better feeling, the bad feeling soon folds its tent like an Arab and silently steals away
quote200.author: William Shakespeare

quote201.quote: Life at its noblest leaves mere happiness far behind; and indeed cannot endure it. Happiness is not the object of life: life has no object: it is an end in itself; and courage consists in the readiness to sacrifice happiness for an intenser quality of life.
quote201.author: George Bernard Shaw

quote202.quote: A lifetime of happiness? No man alive could bear it; it would be hell on earth.
quote202.author: George Bernard Shaw

quote203.quote: Give a man health and a course to steer; and he'll never stop to trouble about whether he's happy or not.
quote203.author: George Bernard Shaw

quote204.quote: Happiness is essentially a state of going somewhere wholeheartedly, one-directionally, without regret or reservation.
quote204.author: W. H. Sheldon

quote205.quote: The soul's joy lies in doing.
quote205.author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote206.quote: There is no end of craving. Hence contentment alone is the best way to happiness. Therefore, acquire contentment.
quote206.author: Sri Swami Sivananda

quote207.quote: What can be added to the happiness of a man who is in health, out of debt, and has a clear conscience?
quote207.author: Adam Smith

quote208.quote: We are never happy; we can only remember that we were so once.
quote208.author: Alexander Smith

quote209.quote: Happiness is a wine of the rarest vintage, and seems insipid to a vulgar taste.
quote209.author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quote210.quote: If you pursue happiness you never find it.
quote210.author: C.P. (Charles Percy) Snow

quote211.quote: The pursuit of happiness is a most ridiculous phrase; if you pursue happiness you'll never find it.
quote211.author: C.P. (Charles Percy) Snow

quote213.quote: Call no man unhappy until he is married.
quote213.author: Socrates

quote214.quote: Like swimming, riding, writing, or playing golf, happiness can be learned.
quote214.author: Boris Sokoloff

quote215.quote: Let no man be called happy before his death. Till then, he is not happy, only lucky.
quote215.author: Solon

quote216.quote: No man is happy; he is at best fortunate.
quote216.author: Solon

quote217.quote: A man is happy so long as he chooses to be happy and nothing can stop him.
quote217.author: Alexandr Solzhenitsyn

quote218.quote: Happiness is never stopping to think if you are.
quote218.author: Palmer Sondreal

quote219.quote: Objects we ardently pursue bring little happiness when gained; most of our pleasures come from unexpected sources.
quote219.author: Herbert Spencer

quote220.quote: It is not how much we have, but how much we enjoy, that makes happiness.
quote220.author: C. H. (Charles Haddon) Spurgeon

quote221.quote: There can be no happiness if the things we believe in are different from the things we do.
quote221.author: Freya Stark

quote222.quote: The human spirit needs to accomplish, to achieve, to triumph to be happy.
quote222.author: Ben Stein

quote223.quote: To describe happiness is to diminish it.
quote223.author: Henri B. Stendhal

quote224.quote: Happiness comes when we test our skills towards some meaningful purpose.
quote224.author: John Stossel

quote225.quote: Happiness consumes itself like a flame. It cannot burn for ever, it must go out, and the presentiment of its end destroys it at its very peak.
quote225.author: J. August Strindberg

quote226.quote: Happiness is a journey not a destination.
quote226.author: Ben Sweetland

quote227.quote: The best advice on the art of being happy is about as easy to follow as advice to be well when one is sick.
quote227.author: Madame Swetchine

quote228.quote: Happiness is a perpetual possession of being well deceived.
quote228.author: Jonathan Swift

quote229.quote: Happiness is an imaginary condition, formerly often attributed by the living to the dead, now usually attributed by adults to children, and by children to adults.
quote229.author: Thomas Szasz

quote230.quote: Good humor is one of the best articles of dress one can wear in society.
quote230.author: William Makepeace Thackeray

quote231.quote: I always cheer up immensely if an attack is particularly wounding because I think, well, if they attack one personally, it means they have not a single political argument left.
quote231.author: Margaret Thatcher

quote232.quote: Be open to your happiness and sadness as they arise.
quote232.author: John M. Thomas

quote233.quote: Man is the artificer of his own happiness.
quote233.author: Henry David Thoreau

quote234.quote: We are made happy when reason can discover no occasion for it. The memory of some past moments is more persuasive than the experience of present ones. There have been visions of such breadth and brightness that these motes were invisible in their light.
quote234.author: Henry David Thoreau

quote235.quote: The secret of Happiness is Freedom, and the secret of Freedom, Courage.
quote235.author: Thucydides

quote236.quote: Men expect that religion should cost them no pains, that happiness should drop into their laps without any design and endeavor on their part, and that, after they have done what they please while they live, God should snatch them up to heaven when they die. But though the commandments of God be not grievous, yet it is fit to let men know that they are not thus easy.
quote236.author: John Tillotson

quote237.quote: No man should desire to be happy who is not at the same time holy. He should spend his efforts in seeking to know and do the will of God, leaving to Christ the matter of how happy he should be.
quote237.author: A. W. Tozer

quote238.quote: Happiness was not made to be boasted, but enjoyed. Therefore tho others count me miserable, I will not believe them if I know and feel myself to be happy; nor fear them.
quote238.author: Thomas Traherne

quote239.quote: You never enjoy the world aright, till the sea itself floweth in your veins, till you are clothed with the heavens and crowned with the stars.
quote239.author: Thomas Traherne

quote240.quote: Happiness ain't a thing in itself --it's only a contrast with something that ain't pleasant. And so, as soon as the novelty is over and the force of the contrast dulled, it ain't happiness any longer, and you have to get something fresh.
quote240.author: Mark Twain

quote241.quote: There are people who can do all fine and heroic things but one: keep from telling their happiness to the unhappy.
quote241.author: Mark Twain

quote242.quote: The best way to cheer yourself up is to try to cheer somebody else up.
quote242.author: Mark Twain

quote243.quote: Happiness is the absence of the striving for happiness.
quote243.author: Chuang Tzu

quote244.quote: Delicate humor is the crowning virtue of the saints.
quote244.author: Evelyn Underhill

quote245.quote: The thing that counts most in the pursuit of happiness is choosing the right companion.
quote245.author: Source Unknown

quote246.quote: The time to be happy is now. The place to be happy is here. The way to be happy is to make others so.
quote246.author: Source Unknown

quote247.quote: The pursuit of happiness is the chase of a life time.
quote247.author: Source Unknown

quote248.quote: Happy are those who dream dreams and are willing to pay the price to make them come true.
quote248.author: Source Unknown

quote249.quote: If happiness could be brought, few of us could pay the price.
quote249.author: Source Unknown

quote250.quote: Happiness... is not a destination: it is a manner of traveling. Happiness is not an end in itself. It is a by-product of working, playing, loving and living.
quote250.author: Haim Ginott

quote251.quote: The true source of cheerfulness is benevolence.
quote251.author: P. Godwin

quote252.quote: The most happy man is he who knows how to bring into relation the end and beginning of his life.
quote252.author: Johann von Goethe

quote253.quote: The man who is born with a talent which he was meant to use finds his greatest happiness in using it.
quote253.author: Johann von Goethe

quote254.quote: What makes people happy is activity; changing evil itself into good by power, working in a God like manner.
quote254.author: Johann von Goethe

quote255.quote: The highest happiness of man is to have probed what is knowable and quietly to revere what is unknowable.
quote255.author: Johann von Goethe

quote256.quote: A person is never happy till their vague strivings has itself marked out its proper limitations.
quote256.author: Johann von Goethe

quote257.quote: Happiness is a ball after which we run wherever it rolls, and we push it with our feet when it stops.
quote257.author: Johann von Goethe

quote258.quote: He is happiest, be he king or peasant, who finds peace in his home.
quote258.author: Johann von Goethe

quote259.quote: If frugality were established in the state, and if our expenses were laid out to meet needs rather than superfluities of life, there might be fewer wants, and even fewer pleasures, but infinitely more happiness.
quote259.author: Oliver Goldsmith

quote260.quote: Remember that happiness is a way of travel, not a destination.
quote260.author: Roy Goodman

quote261.quote: Happiness... she loves, to see men at work. She loves sweat, weariness, self sacrifice. She will be found not in places but lurking in cornfields and factories; and hovering over littered desks; she crowns the unconscious head of the busy child.
quote261.author: David Grayson

quote262.quote: Point me out the happy man and I will point you out either egotism, selfishness, evil --or else an absolute ignorance.
quote262.author: Graham Greene

quote263.quote: Happiness held is the seed; Happiness shared is the flower-Author Unknown People need your love the most when they appear to deserve it the least.
quote263.author: John Harrigan

quote264.quote: Happiness is a butterfly, which, when pursued, is always just beyond your grasp, but which, if you will sit down quietly, may alight upon you.
quote264.author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

quote265.quote: Look up, laugh loud, talk big, keep the color in your cheek and the fire in your eye, adorn your person, maintain your health, your beauty and your animal spirits.
quote265.author: William Hazlitt

quote266.quote: If you were happy every day of your life you wouldn't be a human being, you'd be a game show host.
quote266.author: Gabriel Heatter

quote267.quote: Happiness lies in being privileged to work hard for long hours in doing whatever you think is worth doing. One man may find happiness in supporting a wife and children. Another may find it in robbing banks. Still another may labor mightily for years in pursuing pure research with no discernible result. Note the individual and subjective nature of each case. No two are alike and there is no reason to expect them to be. Each man or woman must find for himself or herself that occupation in which hard work and long hours make him or her happy. Contrariwise, if you are looking for shorter hours and longer vacations and early retirement, you are in the wrong job. Perhaps you need to take up bank robbing. Or geeking in a sideshow. Or even politics.
quote267.author: Robert A. Heinlein

quote268.quote: Happiness is a how, not a what: a talent, not an object
quote268.author: Hermann Hesse

quote269.quote: The loss of wealth is loss of dirt, as sages in all times assert; The happy man's without a shirt.
quote269.author: John Heywood

quote270.quote: Happiness is not a destination. It is a method of life.
quote270.author: Burton Hills

quote271.quote: The search for happiness is one of the chief sources of unhappiness.
quote271.author: Eric Hoffer

quote273.quote: When we recall the past, we usually find that it is the simplest things -- not the great occasions -- that in retrospect give off the greatest glow of happiness.
quote273.author: Bob Hope

quote274.quote: You traverse the world in search of happiness, which is within the reach of every man. A contented mind confers it on all.
quote274.author: Horace

quote275.quote: Many search for happiness as we look for a hat we wear on our heads.
quote275.author: Nikolaus Lenus

quote276.quote: Happiness isn't something you experience; it's something you remember.
quote276.author: Oscar Levant

quote277.quote: Happiness is a by-product. You cannot pursue it by itself.
quote277.author: Samuel Levenson

quote278.quote: God cannot give us a happiness and peace apart from Himself, because it is not there. There is no such thing.
quote278.author: C.S. Lewis

quote279.quote: People are just as happy as they make up their minds to be.
quote279.author: Abraham Lincoln

quote280.quote: Happiness is a thing to be practiced, like the violin.
quote280.author: Sir John Lubbock

quote281.quote: Suspicion of happiness is in our blood.
quote281.author: E. V. Lucas

quote282.quote: The happy think a lifetime short, but to the unhappy one night can be an eternity.
quote282.author: Lucian

quote283.quote: Happiness is not so much in having or sharing. We make a living by what we get, but we make a life by what we give.
quote283.author: Norman Macewan

quote284.quote: Remember that happiness is as contagious as gloom. It should be the first duty of those who are happy to let others know of their gladness.
quote284.author: Maurice Maeterlinck

quote285.quote: Realize that true happiness lies within you. Waste no time and effort searching for peace and contentment and joy in the world outside. Remember that there is no happiness in having or in getting, but only in giving. Reach out. Share. Smile. Hug. Happiness is a perfume you cannot pour on others without getting a few drops on yourself.
quote285.author: Og Mandino

quote286.quote: Talk happiness. The world is sad enough without your woe.
quote286.author: Orison Swett Marden

quote287.quote: The glow of satisfaction which follows the consciousness of doing our level best never comes to a human being from any other experience.
quote287.author: Orison Swett Marden

quote288.quote: Happiness is the interval between periods of unhappiness.
quote288.author: Don Marquis

quote289.quote: Happiness consists in activity -- it is a running stream, not a stagnant pool.
quote289.author: John L. Mason

quote290.quote: Happiness is not a possession to be prized. It is a quality of thought, a state of mind.
quote290.author: Daphne Du Maurier

quote291.quote: Happiness is the light on the water. The water is cold and dark and deep.
quote291.author: William Maxwell

quote292.quote: Success is getting and achieving what you want. Happiness is wanting and being content with what you get.
quote292.author: Bernard Meltzer

quote293.quote: Be it jewel or toy, not the prize gives the joy, but the striving to win the prize.
quote293.author: Owen Meredith

quote294.quote: Happiness is not a matter of events; it depends upon the tides of the mind.
quote294.author: Alice Meynell

quote295.quote: I have learned to seek my happiness by limiting my desires, rather than in attempting to satisfy them.
quote295.author: John Stuart Mill

quote296.quote: Ask yourself whether you are happy, and you cease to be so.
quote296.author: John Stuart Mill

quote297.quote: Act happy, feel happy, be happy, without a reason in the world. Then you can love, and do what you will.
quote297.author: Dan Millman

quote298.quote: In making up the character of God, the old theologians failed to mention that He is of infinite cheerfulness. The omission has caused the world much tribulation.
quote298.author: Michael Monahan

quote299.quote: The smallest annoyances, disturb us the most.
quote299.author: Michel de Montaigne

quote300.quote: Many people think that if they were only in some other place, or had some other job, they would be happy. Well, that is doubtful. So get as much happiness out of what you are doing as you can and don't put off being happy until some future date.
quote300.author: Dale Carnegie

quote301.quote: In order to have great happiness, you have to have great pain and unhappiness-otherwise how would you know when you're happy?
quote301.author: Leslie Caron

quote302.quote: That is happiness: to be dissolved into something complete and great.
quote302.author: Willa Cather

quote303.quote: It seldom happens that any felicity comes so pure as not to be tempered and allayed by some mixture of sorrow.
quote303.author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote304.quote: They say a person needs just three things to be truly happy in this world. Someone to love, something to do, and something to hope for.
quote304.author: Allan K. Chalmers

quote305.quote: The grand essentials of happiness are: something to do, something to love, and something to hope for.
quote305.author: Allan K. Chalmers

quote306.quote: Holiness, not happiness, is the chief end of man.
quote306.author: Oswald Chambers

quote307.quote: The creed of a true saint is to make the best of life, and to make the most of it.
quote307.author: Edwin Hubbell Chapin

quote308.quote: Happiness is a mystery, like religion, and should never be rationalized.
quote308.author: G. K. Chesterton

quote309.quote: Happiness is a continuation of happenings which are not resisted.
quote309.author: Deepak Chopra

quote310.quote: We think a happy life consists in tranquility of mind.
quote310.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote311.quote: Happiness is a hard thing because it is achieved only by making others happy.
quote311.author: Stuart Cloete

quote312.quote: The greatest joy of life is to love and be loved.
quote312.author: R.D. Clyde

quote313.quote: Happiness, or misery, is in the mind. It is the mind that lives.
quote313.author: William Cobbett

quote315.quote: There is this difference between happiness and wisdom, that he that thinks himself the happiest man, really is so; but he who thinks himself the wisest, is generally the greatest fool.
quote315.author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote316.quote: Happiness, that grand mistress of the ceremonies in the dance of life, impels us through all its mazes and meandering, but leads none of us by the same route
quote316.author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote317.quote: We take greater pains to persuade others we are happy than in trying to think so ourselves.
quote317.author: Confucius

quote319.quote: Happiness seems made to be shared.
quote319.author: Pierre Corneille

quote320.quote: Happiness lies first of all in health.
quote320.author: George William Curtis

quote321.quote: Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions.
quote321.author: Dalai Lama

quote322.quote: If you want others to be happy, practice compassion. If you want to be happy, practice compassion.
quote322.author: Dalai Lama

quote323.quote: We begin from the recognition that all beings cherish happiness and do not want suffering. It then becomes both morally wrong and pragmatically unwise to pursue only one's own happiness oblivious to the feelings and aspirations of all others who surround us as members of the same human family. The wiser course is to think of others when pursuing our own happiness.
quote323.author: Dalai Lama

quote324.quote: Happiness is always a by-product. It is probably a matter of temperament, and for anything I know it may be glandular. But it is not something that can be demanded from life, and if you are not happy you had better stop worrying about it and see what treasures you can pluck from your own brand of unhappiness.
quote324.author: Robertson Davies

quote325.quote: The cheerful live longest in years, and afterwards in our regards. Cheerfulness is the off-shoot of goodness.
quote325.author: Christian Nevell Bovee

quote326.quote: A happy family is but an earlier heaven.
quote326.author: Sir John Bowring

quote327.quote: We all want to be happy, and we're all going to die. You might say those are the only two unchallengeably true facts that apply to every human being on this planet.
quote327.author: William Boyd

quote328.quote: Celebrate the happiness that friends are always giving, make every day a holiday and celebrate just living!
quote328.author: Amanda Bradley

quote329.quote: People take different roads seeking fulfillment and happiness. Just because they're not on your road doesn't mean they've gotten lost.
quote329.author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

quote330.quote: The Greeks said grandly in their tragic phrase, Let no one be called happy till his death; to which I would add, Let no one, till his death be called unhappy.
quote330.author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

quote331.quote: What would you call the highest happiness? Wratislaw was ask. The sense of competence, was the answer, given without hesitation.
quote331.author: John Buchan

quote332.quote: Happiness comes more from loving than being loved; and often when our affection seems wounded it is only our vanity bleeding. To love, and to be hurt often, and to love again -- this is the brave and happy life.
quote332.author: J.E Buckrose

quote333.quote: Thousands of candles can be lighted from a single candle, and the life of the candle will not be shortened. Happiness never decreases by being shared.
quote333.author: Buddha

quote334.quote: To live a pure unselfish life, one must count nothing as one's own in the midst of abundance.
quote334.author: Buddha

quote335.quote: Some people never find it, some only pretend, but I just want to live happily ever after every now and then.
quote335.author: Jimmy Buffett

quote336.quote: Happiness and virtue rest upon each other; the best are not only the happiest, but the happiest are usually the best.
quote336.author: Edward George Bulwer-Lytton

quote337.quote: What ever our wandering our happiness will always be found within a narrow compass, and in the middle of the objects more immediately within our reach.
quote337.author: Edward George Bulwer-Lytton

quote338.quote: The secret of happiness is something to do.
quote338.author: John Burroughs

quote339.quote: People are always good company when they are doing what they really enjoy.
quote339.author: Samuel Butler

quote340.quote: To have joy one must share it. Happiness was born a twin.
quote340.author: Lord (George Gordon) Byron

quote341.quote: When you have once seen the glow of happiness on the face of a beloved person, you know that a man can have no vocation but to awaken that light on the faces surrounding him; and you are torn by the thought of the unhappiness and night you cast, by the mere fact of living, in the hearts you encounter.
quote341.author: Albert Camus

quote342.quote: To be happy we must not be too concerned with others.
quote342.author: Albert Camus

quote343.quote: But what is happiness except the simple harmony between a person and life they lead.
quote343.author: Albert Camus

quote344.quote: The only happiness a brave person ever troubles themselves in asking about, is happiness enough to get their work done.
quote344.author: Thomas Carlyle

quote345.quote: But the whim we have of happiness is somewhat thus. By certain valuations, and averages, of our own striking, we come upon some sort of average terrestrial lot; this we fancy belongs to us by nature, and of indefeasible rights. It is simple payment of our wages, of our deserts; requires neither thanks nor complaint. Foolish soul! What act of legislature was there that thou shouldst be happy? A little while ago thou hadst no right to be at all.
quote345.author: Thomas Carlyle

quote346.quote: Wondrous is the strength of cheerfulness, and its power of endurance -- the cheerful man will do more in the same time, will do it ;better, will preserve it longer, than the sad or sullen.
quote346.author: Thomas Carlyle

quote347.quote: Oh, give us the man who sings at his work.
quote347.author: Thomas Carlyle

quote348.quote: Remember, happiness doesn't depend upon who you are or what you have, it depends solely upon what you think.
quote348.author: Dale Carnegie

quote349.quote: Did you ever see an unhappy horse? Did you ever see bird that had the blues? One reason why birds and horses are not unhappy is because they are not trying to impress other birds and horses.
quote349.author: Dale Carnegie

quote350.quote: Cheerfulness in most cheerful people, is the rich and satisfying result of strenuous discipline.
quote350.author: Edwin P. Whipple

quote351.quote: When we are happy we are always good, but when we are good we are not always happy.
quote351.author: Oscar Wilde

quote352.quote: Some cause happiness wherever they go; others whenever they go.
quote352.author: Oscar Wilde

quote353.quote: Developing a cheerful disposition can permit an atmosphere wherein one's spirit can be nurtured and encouraged to blossom and bear fruit. Being pessimistic and negative about our experiences will not enhance the quality of our lives. A determination to be of good cheer can help us and those around us to enjoy life more fully.
quote353.author: Barbara W. Winder

quote354.quote: If we want to know what happiness is we must seek it, not as if it were a part of gold at the end of the rainbow, but among human beings who are living richly and fully the good life. If you observe a really happy man you will find him building a boat, writing a symphony, educating his son, growing double Dahlias in his garden. He will not be searching for happiness as if it were a collar gold button that has rolled under the cupboard in his bed room. He will have become aware that he is happy in the course of living 24 crowded hours of the day. If you live only for yourself you are always an immediate danger of being bored to death with the repetition of your own views and interests. No one has learned the meaning of living until he has surrendered his ego to the service of his fellowmen. If your ambition has the momentum of an express train at full speed, if you can no longer stop your mad rush for glory, power, or intellectual supremacy, try to divert your energies into socially useful channels before it is too late.For those who seek the larger happiness and greater effectiveness open to human beings there can be but one philosophy of life, a philosophy of constructive altruism. The truly happy man is always a fighting optimist. Optimism includes not only altruism but also social responsibility, social courage and objectivity. The good life demands a working philosophy as an orientating map of conduct. This is the golden way of life. This is the satisfying life. This is the way to be happy though human.
quote354.author: W. Beran Wolfe'How To Be Happy Though Human, 1932

quote355.quote: Happiness is neither virtue nor pleasure nor this thing nor that but simply growth, We are happy when we are growing.
quote355.author: William Butler Yeats

quote356.quote: We are happy when for everything inside us there is a corresponding something outside us.
quote356.author: William Butler Yeats

quote357.quote: Happiness radiates like the fragrance from a flower, and draws all good things toward you. Allow your love to nourish yourself as well as others. Do not strain after the needs of life. It is sufficient to be quietly alert and aware of them. In this way life proceeds more naturally and effortlessly. Life is here to Enjoy!
quote357.author: Maharishi Mahesh Yogi

quote358.quote: Often people attempt to live their lives backwards; they try to have more things, or more money, in order to do more of what they want, so they will be happier.
quote358.author: Margaret Young

quote359.quote: Happiness is perfume, you can't pour it on somebody else without getting a few drops on yourself
quote359.author: James Van Der Zee

quote360.quote: Happiness is not pleasure, it is victory.
quote360.author: Zig Ziglar

quote361.quote: People who never achieve happiness are the ones who complain whenever they're awake, and whenever they're asleep, they are thinking about what to complain about tomorrow.
quote361.author: Adam Zimbler

quote362.quote: No one is in control of your happiness but you; therefore, you have the power to change anything about yourself or your life that you want to change.
quote362.author: Barbara De Angelis

quote363.quote: Happiness lies neither in vice nor in virtue; but in the manner we appreciate the one and the other, and the choice we make pursuant to our individual organization.
quote363.author: Marquis De Sade

quote364.quote: Happiness resides not in possessions, and not in gold, happiness dwells in the soul.
quote364.author: Democritus

quote365.quote: Such happiness as life is capable of comes from the full participation of all our powers in the endeavor to wrest from each changing situations of experience its own full and unique meaning.
quote365.author: John Dewey

quote366.quote: Cheerfulness and contentment are great beautifiers and are famous preservers of youthful looks.
quote366.author: Charles Dickens

quote367.quote: I feel an earnest and humble desire, and shall till I die, to increase the stock of harmless cheerfulness.
quote367.author: Charles Dickens

quote368.quote: Gaiety --a quality of ordinary men. Genius always presupposes some disorder in the machine.
quote368.author: Denis Diderot

quote369.quote: The happiness of most people we know is not ruined by great catastrophes or fatal errors, but by the repetition of slowly destructive little things.
quote369.author: Ernest Dimnet

quote370.quote: Action may not always bring happiness; but there is no happiness without action.
quote370.author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote371.quote: The greatest happiness is to know the source of unhappiness.
quote371.author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky

quote372.quote: Happiness does not lie in happiness, but in the achievement of it.
quote372.author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky

quote373.quote: Shall I give you my recipe for happiness? I find everything useful and nothing indispensable. I find everything wonderful and nothing miraculous. I reverence the body. I avoid first causes like the plague.
quote373.author: Norman Douglas

quote374.quote: A happy person is not a person in a certain set of circumstances, but rather a person with a certain set of attitudes.
quote374.author: Hugh Downs

quote375.quote: Happiness is like those palaces in fairy tales whose gates are guarded by dragons: we must fight in order to conquer it.
quote375.author: Alexander Dumas

quote376.quote: It's never too late to have a happy childhood.
quote376.author: Wayne Dyer

quote377.quote: There is no way to happiness. Happiness is the way.
quote377.author: Wayne Dyer

quote378.quote: Happiness is like manna; it is to be gathered in grains, and enjoyed every day. It will not keep; it cannot be accumulated; nor have we got to go out of ourselves or into remote places to gather it, since it has rained down from a Heaven, at our very door
quote378.author: Tryon Edwards

quote379.quote: To fill the hour -- that is happiness.
quote379.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote380.quote: I look on that man as happy, who, when there is question of success, looks into his work for a reply.
quote380.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote381.quote: Happiness is a perfume which you cannot pour on someone without getting some on yourself.
quote381.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote382.quote: So of cheerfulness, or a good temper, the more it is spent, the more it remains.
quote382.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote383.quote: There is only one way to happiness and that is to cease worrying about things which are beyond the power of our will.
quote383.author: Epictetus

quote384.quote: Whoever does not regard what he has as most ample wealth, is unhappy, though he be master of the world.
quote384.author: Epictetus

quote385.quote: If thou wilt make a man happy, add not unto his riches but take away from his desires.
quote385.author: Epicurus

quote386.quote: It is impossible to live a pleasant life without living wisely and well and justly. And it is impossible to live wisely and well and justly without living a pleasant life.
quote386.author: Epicurus

quote387.quote: Happiness is not a state to arrive at, rather, a manner of traveling.
quote387.author: Samuel Johnson

quote388.quote: For who is pleased with himself.
quote388.author: Samuel Johnson

quote389.quote: Our brightest blazes of gladness are commonly kindled by unexpected sparks.
quote389.author: Samuel Johnson

quote390.quote: If you can't be happy where you are, it's a cinch you can't be happy where you ain't.
quote390.author: Charles ''Tremendous'' Jones

quote391.quote: True happiness consists not in the multitude of friends, but in the worth and choice.
quote391.author: Ben Jonson

quote392.quote: Even a happy life cannot be without a measure of darkness, and the word happy would lose its meaning if it were not balanced by sadness. It is far better take things as they come along with patience and equanimity.
quote392.author: Carl Gustav Jung

quote393.quote: In theory there is a possibility of perfect happiness: To believe in the indestructible element within one, and not to strive towards it.
quote393.author: Franz Kafka

quote394.quote: It is not God's will merely that we should be happy, but that we should make ourselves happy
quote394.author: Immanuel Kant

quote395.quote: Many people have the wrong idea of what constitutes true happiness. It is not attained through self-gratification, but through fidelity to a worthy purpose.
quote395.author: Helen Keller

quote396.quote: When one door of happiness closes, another opens; but often we look so long at the closed door that we do not see the one which has opened for us.
quote396.author: Helen Keller

quote397.quote: True happiness is the full use of your powers along lines of excellence in a life affording scope.
quote397.author: John Fitzgerald Kennedy

quote398.quote: My happiness derives from knowing the people I love are happy.
quote398.author: Holly Ketchel

quote399.quote: Happiness is experienced when your life gives you what you are willing to accept.
quote399.author: Ken Keyes Jr.

quote400.quote: The secret of happiness and prosperity in this world, as in the world to come, lies in thinking of the welfare of others first, and not taking one's self too seriously.
quote400.author: J. Kindleberger

quote401.quote: I'm fulfilled in what I do... I never thought that a lot of money or fine clothes -- the finer things of life -- would make you happy. My concept of happiness is to be filled in a spiritual sense.
quote401.author: Coretta Scott King

quote402.quote: We act as though comfort and luxury were the chief requirements of life, when all that we need to make us really happy is something to be enthusiastic about.
quote402.author: Charles Kingsley

quote403.quote: We tend to forget that happiness doesn't come as a result of getting something we don't have, but rather of recognizing and appreciating what we do have.
quote403.author: Frederick Koenig

quote404.quote: Happiness is the longing for repetition.
quote404.author: Milan Kundera

quote405.quote: It is not the place, nor the condition, but the mind alone that can make anyone happy or miserable.
quote405.author: Sir Roger L'Estrange

quote406.quote: No thoroughly occupied man was ever yet very miserable.
quote406.author: Letitia Elizabeth Landon

quote407.quote: We cannot be contented because we are happy, and we cannot be happy because we are contented.
quote407.author: Walter Savage Landor

quote408.quote: We are no longer happy as soon as we wish to be happier.
quote408.author: Walter Savage Landor

quote409.quote: Happiness is something that comes into our lives through doors we don't even remember leaving open.
quote409.author: Rose Wilder Lane

quote410.quote: Seek not happiness too greedily, and be not fearful of unhappiness.
quote410.author: Lao-Tzu

quote411.quote: I am learning to understand rather than immediately judge or to be judged. I cannot blindly follow the crowd and accept their approach. I will not allow myself to indulge in the usual manipulating game of role creation. Fortunately for me, my self-knowledge has transcended that and I have come to understand that life is best to be lived and not to be conceptualized. I am happy because I am growing daily and I am honestly not knowing where the limit lies. To be certain, every day there can be a revelation or a new discovery. I treasure the memory of the past misfortunes. It has added more to my bank of fortitude.
quote411.author: Bruce Lee
